H AFRICA 
122 
Mana
gement of anaemia 
• Look for an underlying cause, and address where possible – iron deficiency is the most common cause
• Take a full history with emphasis on diet, blood loss (menstruation) and obstetric history (number of
pregnancies)
• Refer from a primary health clinic/ community health centre as follows:
Hb <6.0 g/dL Urgent transfer to hospital the same day. 
Hb 6.0-7.9 g/dL Urgent transfer to a hospital if symptomatic (dizziness, tachycardia, shortness of breath at res
